business.headline: ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares tank up to 10%: Why are tobacco shares falling todayShares of Godfrey Phillips India Ltd fell sharply in early trade, sliding nearly 10%. Shares of ITC Ltd also came under pressure, falling around 6% during early trade. The stock slipped to about Rs 379, touching its 52-week low.
Sensex opens 180 points higher, Nifty above 26,150; ITC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 104.21 points to 85,324.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 28.60 points to 26,158.20 as of 9:25 am.

Stock market holiday today? Check if NSE and BSE are closed for New Year 2026Major international stock markets across China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, France, Germany, the UAE, the UK and the US are closed on New Year's Day.

Extra excise duty on tobacco products, cess on pan masala to take effect February 1The new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Indraprastha Gas Limited reduces piped cooking gas prices in Delhi-NCRThe reduction follows the sector regulator Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board's (PNGRB) recent overhaul of pipeline tariffs.

Indian economy to clock strong growth despite global headwinds: RBI GovernorRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said maintaining financial stability, resilient institutions and prudent regulation remains central to safeguarding the economy from external shocks.

Investment guru Warren Buffett retires today. What's his retirement fund?As Warren Buffett, the Oracle of Omaha, steps aside after turning Berkshire Hathaway into a $1.1 trillion conglomerate, questions turn to how the world's most famous investor will fund life after hanging his boots. With nearly all his $149 billion fortune tied up in Berkshire stock, Buffett's retirement corpus is built on long-term bets, compounding, and an empire he still controls.

Earning Rs 1 crore but can't afford a Rs 5 crore home in Gurgaon? Expert explains whyA Rs 1 crore annual salary sounds more than sufficient to buy a house. Yet, many high earners find themselves priced out of the housing market. Here's what an expert says about the real reasons behind this mismatch.

Holiday vs retirement home: How to decide the purpose of your second propertyMany buyers dream of a second home, but few pause to ask a key question: Is it meant for leisure or for life after work? The answer shapes everything from location and cost to comfort and long-term suitability. Let's have a look.
Sensex ends 545 points higher, Nifty above 26,100; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 545.52 points to end at 85,220.60, while the NSE Nifty50 added 190.75 points to close at 26,129.60​​​​​​​.

Vodafone Idea gets more time to pay Rs 87,695 crore AGR duesAccording to sources, the AGR dues amounting to Rs 87,695 crore will now be paid over a ten-year period from FY32 to FY41. While the decision eases near-term repayment pressure, it does not involve any waiver, haircut, or reduction in the total dues.

Did New Year's Eve strike by Swiggy, Zomato riders hit customers across India?With platforms heavily dependent on delivery partners during year-end celebrations, there was uncertainty over how widely the strike would be observed.

Last day to file revised ITR: Follow these simple steps for quick processingToday is the final day for taxpayers to submit a revised Income Tax Return. If you have spotted any mistake in your earlier filing, following a few simple steps can help you complete the process quickly and smoothly.

Silver prices crash after record rally. What should investors do now?Silver futures on MCX are trading sharply lower near Rs 2,37,000–2,38,000 per kg, after closing at Rs 2,32,723 in the previous session. The decline reflects the steep correction in global prices.

Why mid-career professionals feel financially stretched after switching jobsMid-career executives usually fall into the age group of 35 – 45 depending on the industry or job roles they occupy. By this time, they have their children studying in schools, financial commitments like home and vehicle loans and, in many cases, ageing parents to look after.

Gold at record high: Why Indians are choosing coins and ETFs over jewelleryGold prices in India have surged to historic highs in 2025, leading many consumers to shift from traditional jewellery purchases to coins, bars, and other investment forms.

Swiggy, Zomato raise delivery incentive amid New Year's Eve strike: ReportThe rise in incentives comes ahead of New Year's Eve, one of the busiest days for food delivery and online orders, when worker unions have called for fresh protests.

From Reliance Jio, PhonePe to Zepto: 5 key IPOs to watch in 2026India's IPO pipeline for 2026 is packed with some of the country's most talked-about companies. From established giants like Reliance Jio to fast-growing startups such as Zepto, several big listings are expected to keep investors busy.

How India overtook China to become the world's top rice producerIndia has emerged as the world's largest rice producer, but closing the yield gap and managing water stress will decide whether this production surge becomes a lasting advantage.

Hindustan copper share price tanks 3%: What's behind the fall?Copper prices have risen sharply this year due to supply disruptions at key global mines and strong demand from sectors such as electrification, renewable energy and artificial intelligence-led infrastructure.

entertainment.headline: Rajinikanth nails social media game with New Year post featuring iconic Muthu clip Superstar Rajinikanth surprised fans by sharing a motivational New Year wish using a classic Muthu film clip. Fans were blown away by the actor's social media game.

From Toxic to Billa Ranga Basha: 7 Kannada films to look out for in 2026 The 2026 theatrical slate for Kannada cinema looks jam-packed, with stars leading the charge and promising new talent backing them up all year long.

Ikkis review: Dharmendra-Agastya's war film breaks away from chest-thumping patriotismRelease Date:Thu Jan 01, 2026 Ikkis movie review: Ikkis narrates the story of young soldier Arun Khetarpal's valour in the 1971 war. The film sensitively explores war's lasting personal and familial trauma beyond patriotic heroism.

Pa Ranjith, Santhosh Narayanan condemn attack on migrant worker in Tamil Nadu Director Pa Ranjith and composer Santhosh Narayanan have spoken out against the recent assault on an Odisha migrant worker in Tiruttani, Tamil Nadu. They urged authorities to address the root causes of such violence and ensure accountability.

Confirmed: BTS to make a full-group comeback in March. Check out the date here BTS will officially return as a full group on March 20, 2026 after nearly four years. The comeback follows individual military service and promises a global tour including India.

That's the problemRelease Date:Thu Jan 01, 2026 Stranger Things season 5 finale wraps up the beloved series with emotional moments and character resolutions. Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan trailer out on January 2? Fans await first look The trailer for Thalapathy Vijay's much-awaited film Jana Nayagan is anticipated to launch on January 2, ahead of the movie's theatrical release during Pongal 2026. An official announcement is awaited.

Jennifer Lope ,z56, shuts down 'dress your age' trolls with perfect comeback Jennifer Lopez responded to comments about her bold fashion choices and age during the launch of her Up All Night residency in Las Vegas, directly confronting critics from the stage.

Netflix crashes following Stranger Things Finale premiere. Again. Netflix experienced widespread service disruptions as the Stranger Things finale premiered. The outage left thousands unable to stream and raised concerns about the platform's capacity during peak demand.

Ocean's 14: George Clooney reunites Julia Roberts, Brad Pitt and original cast George Clooney has revealed the original Ocean's cast will reunite for Ocean's 14. The filming is targeted for next October with a fresh focus on pulling off a heist in their later years.

Vijay Deverakonda's New Year post from Rome has fans noticing Rashmika Mandanna Vijay Deverakonda posted images from his New Year trip to Rome on Instagram on January 1. Fans are now speculating that Rashmika Mandanna was also present based on reflections and group shots.

Is BTS gearing up for March 2026 comeback? New Year postcards spark fan frenzy A special postcard sent to BTS's Korean ARMY gold members has led to widespread speculation about a possible group comeback date and world tour in spring 2026.  Fans are analysing every detail as the group shares handwritten New Year messages.

Prabhas' New Year gift for fans: Spirit first poster on January 1. Check it here The makers of Spirit have unveiled the film's first look poster featuring Prabhas. The reveal marks the first major visual update from the Sandeep Reddy Vanga directorial.

Ikkis debutant Simar Bhatia praises co-star Agastya Nanda, director Sriram Raghavan Simar Bhatia thanked 'Ikkis' director Sriram Raghvan in 2025 gratitude note. Simar is making her acting debut in the film, also featuring Agastya Nanda, late actor Dharmendra and Jaideep Ahlawat in pivotal roles.

Border 2: Anu Malik clarifies on Ghar Kab Aaoge credit issue, thanks Bhushan Kumar Anu Malik issued a clarification over the credit issue in 'Ghar Kab Aaoge' from 'Border 2' (2026). He thanked producer Bhushan Kumar in his statement.

Prateik Smita Patil says film industry isn't man's world, women can call the shots Prateik Smita Patil expressed his views on the image of empowered women in modern cinema. He reflected on how his mother late Smita Patil paved the way for women to "stand up for themselves."

Cold New Year: North India shivers, snow blankets Kashmir, rain sweeps MumbaiFrom thunderstorms in Rajasthan to snowfall in Kashmir and Himachal, New Year's day saw north India shivering amid biting cold conditions. For Mumbai, 2026 began on a wet note as several parts witnessed heavy rain.

Disrespect to Christ's Last Supper? Kochi Biennale venue shut after artwork sparks rowThe controversy centres around a painting by Kerala-based artist Tom Vattakuzhy, exhibited as part of the Biennale's curated show 'Idam'. Christian organisations alleged that the artwork hurt religious sentiments and disrespected the traditional depiction of Jesus Christ and the Last Supper.

New Year welcomed with spectacular fireworks across worldThe world welcomes 2026 with celebrations unfolding across time zones, from fireworks in the Pacific and Australia to quieter, tradition-led events in parts of Asia and Europe, alongside large public gatherings and heightened security in major global cities.

UP man resurfaces for SIR 28 years after going missingPresumed dead for almost 28 years, an elderly man returned to his home in Uttar Pradesh's Khatauli, bringing a mix of disbelief and relief to his family and neighbourhood. Setback for H-1B visa fee fight as Obama-appointed judge calls US govt move legalA US District Court has ruled that the high fee on new H-1B visas imposed by the Trump administration is legal. The petitioner, the US Chamber of Commerce, has now filed a plea with the US Appeals court. It was an Obama-appointed judge who ruled in favour of the high H-1B visa fee.

Live: Thunderstorms likely across Delhi-NCR, north India; temperatures to dipDelhi Air Pollution Live Updates: Delhi's air quality remained in the "very poor" category on New Year's Day, with the Air Quality Early Warning System for Delhi recording an AQI of 382, as cold and foggy conditions continued to grip the national capital. The India Meteorological Department said Delhi is likely to witness a generally cloudy sky on Thursday, with a possibility of very light to light rain at isolated places. The forecast also warned of moderate fog at many places and dense fog at isolated locations during morning hours. These conditions follow a harsh spell of weather on the last day of 2025, the coldest day recorded in Delhi since 2019. The maximum temperature settled at 14.2 degrees Celsius, which is 6.2 degrees below normal for this time of year. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

CBSE releases revised datesheet for Class 10, 12 board exams. Check new schedule hereCBSE has released the revised datesheet for the Class 10 and Class 12 board exams 2026, postponing select papers that were scheduled for March 3 due to administrative reasons. All other CBSE examination dates remain unchanged. Students are advised to check the updated schedule and prepare for the board exams accordingly.

Parents still push these courses. But students don't want themMany courses parents still recommend — like broad arts, general business or traditional science degrees — are no longer top choices for Indian students in 2025. Data from university admissions and hiring trends show that learners now prefer programmes linked directly to clear careers and skills that improve job chances fast.

sports.headline: Mandhana seeks blessings at Mahakaleshwar temple with team India to start 2026 Smriti Mandhana visited the Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain to offer prayers and attend the Bhasm Aarti on the first day of 2026 along with the Indian women's cricket team.

CSK and MI combo wreak havoc in SA20: Brevis, Rutherford smash 6 sixes in a row Dewald Brevis and Sherfane Rutherford lit up the SA20 with a brutal finishing act for Pretoria Capitals. Their six-sixes blitz powered a massive win and marked Brevis' return to form.

January transfer window: A lifeline for out-of-favour players' World Cup dreams With the January transfer window opening on January 1, it represents a last chance for some players to revive their World Cup hopes. With the 2026 tournament now only months away, a growing number of footballers will view January as a crucial turning point. From established internationals to emerging talents, the window can offer a lifeline for those who have slipped out of favour at their current clubs.

Khawaja should retire on his terms at homeground in Sydney: Michael Vaughan Michael Vaughan has suggested that Usman Khawaja should retire on his own terms during the upcoming fifth Ashes Test in Sydney. Khawaja has been struggling with form since 2024 and injuries have also troubled him during the ongoing series.

Australia name spin-heavy squad for T20 World Cup, Cummins picked despite injury Australia have announced a 15-member spin-heavy squad for the T20 World Cup 2026, set to begin on February 7. Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Tim David have been named despite injuries.

Improve your body language: Gus Atkinson given advice by Broad after poor Ashes England legend Stuart Broad said that Gus Atkinson needs to improve on his body language after a flat performance during the Ashes series in Australia. Atkinson failed to impress for the visitors in the three matches he played.

Roberto Carlos undergoes immediate surgery after heart problem detected Former Brazil and Real Madrid defender Roberto Carlos underwent heart surgery in Brazil after a medical test revealed a heart dysfunction. The procedure lasted nearly three hours due to complications, but Carlos reports he is now recovering and under medical observation.

Virat Kohli steps into New Year with light of his life Anushka Sharma, says bye to 2025 Virat Kohli rang in 2026 by sharing a joyful masked moment with his wife Anushka Sharma, calling her the light of his life as he bid goodbye to 2025. Kohli recently played in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, returning to play the List A tournament after 15 years.

Zimbabwe star Sikandar Raza suffers personal tragedy as young brother dies at 13Zimbabwe's T20I captain Sikandar Raza has suffered a personal tragedy as his younger brother Muhammad Mahdi passed away at the age of 13.

Babar vs Rizwan: When and where to watch Pakistan stars in BBL on New Year's DayBBL 2025-26: Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan will be in action on New Year's Day when Sydney Sixers and Melbourne Renegades lock horns at the Docklands Stadium in Melbourne.

WPL 2026: Lizelle Lee, Marizanne Kapp start training with Delhi Capitals in GoaVeteran South Africa all-rounder Marizanne Kapp, along with compatriot Lizelle Lee, who played a key role in Hobart's recent WBBL title triumph, has joined the Delhi Capitals training session ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League.

After Sarfaraz Khan Vijay Hazare blitz, Ashwin wants Mumbai star as CSK regularR Ashwin has backed Sarfaraz Khan to be a regular for CSK in their starting XII for the upcoming IPL season. Sarfaraz has been in scintillating form in domestic white-ball cricket for Mumbai this year.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Rishabh Pant struggles for impact amid chatter of ODI snubVijay Hazare Trophy: Delhi lost their first game in the Vijay Hazare Trophy after Rishabh Pant-led Delhi fell to Odisha on Wednesday, December 31. Pant continued to have a poor time in the competition amidst murmurs of a drop from the ODI squad.

Indian football federation asks ISL clubs to confirm participation amid delayThe AIFF on Wednesday asked ISL clubs to confirm their participation and preferred format for the delayed season within a day to inform the continental body of the match count.

Shreyanka Patil touched as RCB fan names daughter in her honour before WPL 2026RCB all‑rounder Shreyanka Patil touched hearts off the field when a fan named their daughter after her. She is set to make a strong comeback in WPL 2026 after missing out last season due to injury.

Mohammed Shami confident of ODI comeback against New ZealandFast bowler Mohammed Shami's camp is confident that the fast bowler will make his return in international cricket with the ODI series against New Zealand. Shami has been in terrific form since the start of the home season.

Australia's Travis Head hopes to revive Ashes tradition with post-series drinksTravis Head hopes Australia and England will come together for a drink once the Ashes concludes in Sydney, restoring a tradition that was lost after the 2023 series.

Vaishnavi Sharma spills the secret behind special celebration with Harmanpreet KaurVaishnavi Sharma revealed that her choreographed wicket celebration with Harmanpreet Kaur in the fourth Women's T20I was a pre-planned team-huddle idea, capping an impressive series in which she emerged as a joint-highest wicket-taker.

Inspired by icons: Jerrssis Wadia draws lessons from Virat Kohli, Yuvraj SinghAustralian youngster Jerrssis Wadia, inspired by Yuvraj Singh's comeback and shaped by lessons from Virat Kohli and Travis Head, has announced himself in BBL 2025–26 for the Adelaide Strikers.

Bumrah's No.1 Test rank under threat from Australia pacer, Pakistan spinnerJasprit Bumrah's spot at the top of the ICC Test rankings for bowlers continues to remain under threat with Mitchell Starc and Noman Ali breathing down the neck of the Indian pacer.

Gulbadin, Naveen return as Afghanistan name Rashid Khan-led T20 World Cup squadRashid Khan will lead Afghanistan in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, to be staged in India and Sri Lanka. The Afghanistan Cricket Board confirmed the leg-spinner as captain while announcing a 15-member squad for the marquee tournament.

Not a Test specialist any more. Sarfaraz Khan smashes 75-ball 157 after IPL contractVijay Hazare Trophy: Sarfaraz Khan smashed a 75-ball 157 for Mumbai, steering them to a mammoth total of 444 in Jaipur on Wednesday. Sarfaraz has been in fine form in white-ball domestic circuit.

Cristiano Ronaldo hits 'cringe' SIU, fans calls out shameless celebrationLegendary Cristiano Ronaldo was heavily criticised by football fans after wildly celebrating one of his goals in the Saudi Pro League. Many called him selfish, stating that Ronaldo is only motivated to score 1000 career goals and does not care about his team and teammates.

Gaikwad warms up for New Zealand series with splendid century in Vijay HazareRuturaj Gaikwad scored a magnificent 124 to help Maharashtra post 331 against Uttarakhand in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. He will next feature in India's ODI series against New Zealand starting January 11.

Padikkal knocks on India ODI selection door with 3rd hundred in four matchesKarnataka batter Devdutt Padikkal kept his India ODI ambitions firmly alive with his third century in four matches in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy. The left-hander continued his prolific run by reaching three figures once again, this time against Puducherry at the ADSA Railways Cricket Ground in Ahmedabad.

England to win next Ashes in Australia: Former cricketer makes bizarre predictionFormer England cricketer Phil Tufnell has made a bold prediction regarding England's Ashes prospects in Australia. The former spinner has backed the English side to end their Ashes series victory down under in their next series in the country.

Cricket fraternity rallies around Damien Martyn as serious illness leaves him in comaAdam Gilchrist, R Ashwin and VVS Laxman were among the cricketers who sent messages of support to Damien Martyn after the former Australia batter was hospitalised with meningitis. Messages from across the cricketing world followed as former teammates, opponents, and current players wished Martyn strength and a speedy recovery while he remains under medical care.

These are our favourite sporting moments of 2025. What is yours?Records fell, waits ended and futures arrived early in 2025, a year when sport refused to slow down, and left us all with moments worth arguing about long after the final whistle. Which moment gave you goosebumps, joy or disbelief? Tell us the one you'll never forget.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
